c.sp: library|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Code of Law|1|1.01|1.01.040

c.x: The Council shall consist of three (3) Chiefs, three (3) Sub-Chiefs and one
Each year one (1) Chief and one (1) Sub-Chief will be elected to the Counci
Composition
Chiefs and Sub-Chiefs will be elected to three (3) year terms of office.
Tribal Clerk will be elected to a three (3) year term of office.
Eligibility to run for Council shall be determined by the Tribal Election O
Term of Office and Eligibility
To promote and protect the health, safety, education and general welfare of
To enact ordinances and adopt resolutions as the Tribe, and to enforce the
To negotiate with Tribes, Federal, State and other national Governments.
To charter subordinate organizations, including housing, financial, economi
To establish a Tribal Education System exclusively for the benefit of its m
To employ legal counsel and fix compensation and fees.
To regulate its own procedures for the management of Council business throu
To regulate the use and disposition of all land within the jurisdiction of
To enact ordinances providing for the removal or exclusion of any non-membe
To provide by ordinance for the establishment and regulation of organizatio
To borrow money and issue bonds and other evidences of indebtedness for the
To negotiate and contract with the Federal, State, Local and other governme
To levy and collect fees general and special assessments from any members o
To request the Secretary of Interior to confer trust or reservation status
To advise the Tribe and members on all appropriation estimates and Federal
To provide by ordinance for the jurisdiction of the Tribe over Indian Child
To administer the tribal government and conduct inquiries and hearing on th
To apply for or accept grants, cooperative agreements, and donations from a
To take any action that may be necessary to defend the rights of Tribal mem
To take any action that may be necessary to carry out the initiatives of th
To take any action that may be necessary to carry out the sovereign authori
Powers and Duties of the Council
Chief dies during term of office.
Chief deemed mentally incompetent by a licensed physician, with authenticat
Chief is removed, (see Section V).
Chief resigns.
The Sub-Chief shall have all the power and shall perform all the duties of
The Chief may give authority to his or her Sub Chief to act upon his or her
The duties of the Sub-Chief are determined by their respective Chief.
Powers and Duties of the Sub-Chiefs
As defined in the Tribe's Judiciary Act, as amended from time to time.
Powers and Authority of the Tribal Court
As defined in the Tribal Clerk Act, as amended from time to time.
Powers and Authority of the Tribal Clerk

Council members may also be recalled pursuant to the provisions of the "Tri

In order for a referendum to be placed on the ballot for a vote, the Member
The Member must register the petition with the Tribal Clerk, who shall dete
In order for the referendum to be validly approved it must pass by a majori

Fundamental changes to the rights of membership of the Tribe;

Fundamental changes in the basic government structure of the Tribe; and
Non-budgeted, non-emergency expenditures by the Tribe, of Tribal General Fu

Authority of the Council to Initiate Referendums

c.sp: library|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Code of Law|1|1.01|1.01.070

c.x: The May Tribal meeting will be held on the second Saturday.
The June Tribal meeting will be held on the second Saturday.
The Council shall schedule regular meetings on the first Saturday of each m
The meetings shall be held at the Tribal Community Building or such place a
The meetings shall be chaired by one of the Chiefs.
The meetings shall be open to all Members.
If a Member wants to have an item on the Agenda s/he must call the Council'
The Chief who is chairing the meeting shall decide upon the final agenda fo
General Provisions
Meetings will begin promptly at 10:00 a.m. and will adjourn no later than 1
The Tribal Clerk shall take a count to determine if a quorum (twenty-five (
If there is no quorum by 10:15 a.m., there is no meeting.
If a quorum is present, the Chair shall call the meeting to order.
Rules of Procedure for Meetings
Conduct should be respectful in the Meetings.
Members should not interrupt while another is speaking.
Comments should be constructive and directed to the topic that is being dis
There shall be a time limit of five (5) minutes for any one member to discu
There will be no discussions of a personal nature.
There will be no discussions related to personnel issues.
Photographs and videos of the meetings are not permitted unless prior appro
Violation of any of the above rules may result in a tribal member being rem
Rules of Personal Conduct for Meetings
With the exception of personal and/or personnel matters, Members may make m
The motion must be presented in a form that clearly states the action being
The motion will pass upon a majority vote of Members, at the meeting.
If the motion passes, the Council will place that issue on its Agenda for t
In response to such motions, it is the responsibility of Council to conside
In the event that the Council determines not to take action upon a motion f
Motions from the Floor
The Tribal Monthly Meeting shall be electronically recorded by the Office o
Should a Member wish to listen to the recording, the Tribal Clerk shall set
The minutes of the Tribal Monthly Meeting shall consist of a summary of the
Meeting Minutes

The Council may take official action on pressing matters outside of Work Se

c.sp: library|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Code of Law|1|1.01|1.01.100

c.x: Formal enactment of Tribal Laws, Acts or Ordinances (together "Ordinances")
An Ordinance may be proposed by the Council, any Tribal Member or any Depar
Initial review by the Council shall be conducted within thirty (30) days.
The Tribal Clerk shall issue a notice to the Tribal Membership that such le
Following the draft comment period, Tribal Council shall have at least thir
Once a final draft is complete, it shall be submitted to the Tribal Clerk,
Upon the conclusion of the final thirty (30) day notice period, Tribal Coun
The proposed ordinance and the review process, including provisions for rev
In the event that Tribal Council elects to put the pending Ordinance to a r
The Election Board will ensure the Appeal Process of the Referendum Electio
The Election Board will certify the Referendum Election Vote and present th
The Pending Ordinance is enacted and Tribal Council shall take all steps ne
If the Referendum results in a vote to accept the Pending Ordinance:
The Election Board will conduct the Appeal Process of the Referendum Electi
The Election Board will certify the Referendum Election Vote and present th
The process is terminated and the Pending Ordinance and a copy of the certi
If the Referendum results in a vote to not accept the Pending Ordinance:

c.x: The names and titles of employees of the Tribe;

Salary, bonuses and benefits received by elected or appointed officials of
Human resource policy manuals;
Tribal Court opinions or court decisions (subject to redaction of confident
Tribal ordinances, policies and resolutions and amendments thereto;
Publicly filed organizing documents of any Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal entity
Annual financial audits, all financial disclosures that have been deemed op
Minutes of Tribal Council open meetings, as per TCR 2011-55;
List of eligible voters (can only be viewed in the clerk's office from Cauc
Statistical data of Tribal members (numbers only); and
Election candidate lists, voting results.
Open Records: The following categories of information are "open" and availa
Laws and Policies
Company and/or business names
Newsletters
Policies and procedures such as personnel policy and court procedures.
Sex offender registry
Media Releases and publications
Public Records: The following information is deemed "Public" and is availab
Proposals and bids for any contract or agreement, including information whi
Contracts or other agreements which specifically prohibit disclosure of the
Any and all records related to: contracts containing a confidentiality or n
Any personally identifiable information including medical, financial, perso
Privileged attorney-client information or attorney work product and all rel
Records of law enforcement agencies, prosecution, or regulatory agencies th
Matters specifically exempted from disclosure by applicable federal, state,
Any records containing proprietary information, trade secrets or informatio
Drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinio
Inter-office communications relating to proposals or matters which have not
Records that would reveal the exact location of archaeological sites;
Records related to security and community safety;
Any court records that would otherwise not be disclosed by the court, any r
Records or information for which disclosure would jeopardize the functionin
Geological and geophysical information and data, including maps, concerning
Any information related to higher education and student records; and
Value of rare books or collections
Exceptions and Limitations

Officially and publicly announce election results.

The Election Board shall be responsible for maintaining accurate and organi
